pageContext.claim: “The Democrats are absolute hypocrites. All along, they've been supporting walls and supporting fences and supporting all sorts of border security. The fact is they've always supported fences and walls and partitions, but you know what? They only don't want to do it because of me.”
pageContext.analysis: Chuck Schumer, Hillary Clinton and many other Democrats voted for the Secure Fence Act of 2006, which authorized building a fence along about 700 miles of the border between the United States and Mexico. It passed 283-138 in the House, with 64 Democrat votes, and 80-19 in the Senate, with 26 Democrat votes. But the fence they voted for is not as substantial as the wall Trump is proposing. Trump himself has called the 2006 fence a "nothing wall."
